Hi all,

we are trying to figure out what is the best heritrix and server setup to run large scale crawls.
At our lab we used two different server setups and run the exactly same crawl on both of the servers.

Just to make things short, here the summary

Aim: What is the best value hardware for running Heritrix and how is
craw performance developing throughout a crawl.

Test setup: both machines run Linux 64 bit Sun JVM 1.6.0_06

Machine A (left in the comparision.png):
AMD Athlon 64 X2 5600+ Dual Core, 4GB RAM, 2 * 500GB SATAII drives
(SAMSUNG HD501LJ)

Machine B (right  in the comparision.png):
Interl quad core XEON 2.33GHz, 8GB RAM, disk, 2 * 400GB SATAII drives

Except for the disks machine 2 should be aprox. 2 times powerful. We
have run a simple crawl with 1 million seeds to check how both machines
perform. Results attached.

Preliminary  findings:
*CPU* A uses about 75% of its cpu, B about 37% of its cpu

*RAM* A got 2.5GB and B 5GB heap

*Throughput*
A got 80-140 docs/sec B got 40-70 docs/sec
A got 12-30 MBit/sec B got 40-55 MBit/sec

While we do understand the aprox. 2-1 performance relation, we do not
understand why the performance of machine A shows a steady decline (50%
over 24h) while machine B it is not a steady decline and only around 10%.

Our first guess would be the difference in RAM available to the BDB
cache. Can anybody confirm this? Will also an 8 GB machine eventually
slow down significantly? Does anybody know the reason - is it the
queuing of new URIs?

Would be nice if we can discuss this 
Best juergen
